bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: ① Etiological Agent. of yu xue 瘀血② , stagnant blood, which has merged with internal heat. Shang han lun 傷寒論 237: 其人喜忘者，必有蓄血 , “When such persons have a tendency to be forgetful the reason must be amassed blood ”.

② Pathological Condition brought forth by a merger of stagnant blood with heat when, during an episode of harm caused by cold, heat abounds and meets stagnant blood. The major clinical signs are a hot body, hardening of the lower abdomen, hardening of stools, free flow of urine, and a tendency to be forgetful. In severe cases patients behave as if they were mad. Shang han ming li lun 傷寒明理論 Mj: 蓄血之證，又有輕重焉。 如狂也，喜忘也，皆蓄血之甚者，須抵當湯丸以下之 , “The conditions of amassed blood may be light or severe. They may include states like madness and a tendency to be forgeful. In all severe cases of amassed blood one must use an appropriate decoction or pills to discharge it”. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 quotes 蓄血 as 畜血 .
